H0.text: The tunica intima, or intima, is the inner layer of what in the human body. Lymphatic vessels

H1.text: The tunica intima, or intima, is the inner layer of what in the human body. Respiratory tract

H2.text: The tunica intima, or intima, is the inner layer of what in the human body. Gastrointestinal tract

H3.text: The tunica intima, or intima, is the inner layer of what in the human body. Arteries/veins

A4.text: The innermost layer, which is in direct contact with the flow of blood, is the tunica intima.

A5.text: The arterial wall consists of three layers called tunics, namely the tunica intima, tunica media, and tunica externa, from innermost to outermost.
